text: Stayed at this resort for 5 days with family - the views, pool, room and staff were first class - such a great property and close to everything in Carvoierio - couldnt recommend more

parents came here for their 22nd visit and my partner and I joined them in their second week.  our 3rd visit to this hotel.. wonderful vacation..  Great hotel, very welcoming and friendly staff, staff on reception, in the bar, maids and breakfast room.. everyone so very pleasant. rooms very clean and maid in daily, breakfast had good choice. the weather was fantastic and the roof top pool and terrace was great to chill out in. good selection of snacks and drinks reasonable. we cant wait to come back here next year. if we hadnt already booked to go to tenerife in October, we would be booking here for sure. Excellent hotel and excellent holiday!!
The Belmar has exceptional quality and services. Their staff were excellent.While it was only a walk away from a stunning beach, sitting poolside was a real pleasure as well.

We had a great time. An exceptional view from our room. Amazing service from all the staff and they speak multiple languages. The food is excellentand the small village of Carvoeiro is ready if you want to go out for a walk or go to a restaurant. If I had to say one small negative comment, it was very hot in our room... the air conditioning did not manage to reach a comfortable temperature even though we left our curtains closed all day.It‚Äôs just a small detail because our stay was fantastic!

Staying here right now room 1049 can not speak highly enough of standard of room, food ,staff . Faultless. 10th floor views amazing absolutely will be coming again . It's only our second day and can say without a doubt that I will be recommending this hotel to my friends in fact I already have .

date: Ana Patricia Owrote a review May 2025
text: Excellent space, happy kids, staff 5 stars.It was relaxing and at the same time a lot of fun and new friendships.Very worth it and surrounded by nature.Joining the hotel the horse and charrete activity was of the best moments with Mr. Jorge in command with a huge heart and immense way with children.Will stay in memory

There are many things to say about this hotel which are very positive, but also some very important more negative comments which people should be aware of, in my opinion. I will start with the rooms. The rooms are tastefully decorated and spacious and the bed was probably the most comfortable we have ever slept in at a hotel. It is easily a super king or possibly emperor size and the mattress is firm, but not too firm. Our sleep quality was also helped by the excellent sound installation, meaning that you did not hear anything from neighbouring rooms or corridors. On the downside, or at least in my opinion, the ensuite bathroom is actually incorporated into the bedroom, rather than being in a separate room with a door. The shower is a transparent glass cubicle which is a generous size but completely unshielded from the bedroom. Although this means you can watch TV whilst you shower, you are also in full view of any other occupants in the room ‚Äì which is not for everybody! The toilet is protected by a sliding glass door but there is no sound installation or really enough privacy for most people's tastes. The overall decor and look of the hotel is quite stylish and luxurious and, of course, the structure is new meaning there is very little wear and tear. That said, we were surprised that a number of things had already been broken or had stopped working and the ongoing maintenance appeared to be lacking. (Examples: the electronic darts for the darts board had been broken and not replaced during our two week stay. The shower cubicles in the spa had broken handles on the showers and the towel hooks on the wall in the changing room had snapped off, the bases around the parasols by the pool had been broken in high winds etc. There were plenty of sunbeds available on the eighth floor and on the second floor, although not all of them get the sun at all times of the day. One point that irritated me and is worth mentioning, is that you are given a pool towel each at the beginning of your stay and then informed that you will be charged one euro per towel for each time that you attempt to change it for a fresh one. Whilst I appreciate this as an eco-measure and they're trying to limit the unnecessary washing of multiple towels, I felt that making a charge to change your pool towel during the two weeks day was ridiculous. Equally, a ‚Ç¨12 per week charge to utilise the safe felt like a penny pinching measure in a luxury hotel. Please also note that there is also a ‚Ç¨6 per day charge to use the hotel carpark ‚Äì something you may need to know if you have a hire car. That said, there is limited free street parking nearby. My husband was also disconcerted to note that there was no ironing ironing board available for guests and any ironing needs to be sent out to the hotel's laundry service - naturally at a charge. Similarly, you should be aware that the spa entry is ‚Ç¨20 per person per day (although we had free spa access as part of our hotel package and this is therefore sometimes available depending on how and where you book). The spa treatments themselves were also a little pricey (‚Ç¨80 for a 50 minute massage), but the massage (with Keila) was fantastic and possibly the best I have ever had in a hotel spa. We were half-board, meaning that we had breakfast and evening meal every day, although we did exchange our evening meal for a lunch on one occasion. We did not feel that the quality of food in Madeira as a whole was particularly good and therefore, in the light of that, I would say that the hotel food was actually quite reasonable. That said, there was limited choice at the buffet and only one station from which to serve yourself, meaning that queues sometimes built up. It is also worth noting that the buffet staff were quite slow at replenishing dishes and often of the three or four options available only one or two was still available at any one time. The organisation in the restaurant as a whole was quite chaotic and it was difficult, particularly in the morning for breakfast service, to find a table. There was also only one chef ever cooking eggs, omelettes and pancakes, meaning that you could easily wait 20 to 25 minutes for an egg dish.There were insufficient staff throughout the hotel, including in the restaurant, so many tables were full of dirty dishes that hadn't been cleared and nobody helped you find somewhere to sit. This was the same every day for two weeks and it was also difficult to find somebody to serve drinks. There was often very little information about what food was being served, with inadequate or missing descriptive cards. On the positive side, there was at least one dish every meal which was tasty and the atmosphere in the restaurant was appealing. As regards the √† la cart restaurant where we had lunch on the one occasion, we waited over an hour before we were served (again because of inadequate staffing). The only alternative to the √† la carte restaurant for a lunchtime service was the pool or beach bar which had a very limited menu indeed. My reflections overall are that this is a nice hotel which could be very good indeed, but the impression given by the staff is that they are overworked as a result of being too few in number, meaning that they are sometimes less than friendly and very slow (I waited an hour for an extra towel for example). This is also the first four star hotel where glasses left out by people from the restaurant the night before are still around the pool at midday, or even the following evening.   If the staffing issues could be resolved, then I feel the hotel would be greatly improved. I made this point during our stay, but there was no sign that anything had changed whilst we were there and judging by the comments in the guest book on reception, this has been a problem since opening. I can only hope that it is an issue which is addressed in the future as this could be a lovely place to stay.

Just returned home from this hotel after two weeks. Its very good - I'd return. Not perfect, though.Good points :Great beds, excellent sleepGood breakfast (although last few days moved on to horrible thick pancakes, after a week of delicious waffles and thin pancakes)Exellent showerRoom serviced twice a dayWonderful viewsHandy for townGood air conditioningFriendly staffPlenty of sunbedsBad:Food in evening really could be better - best meals we had were eating out. 3 star here at best. And this is a major part of a holiday.Check in takes ages - I've no idea why.Turn down service (much appreciated) tends to happen about 1900 - we're still getting ready for dinner.Not sure about the glass bathroom wall!Overall, I'd return, but maybe just b and b.

Nice building and layout.  Quite a secluded location.  Limited activities without a hire car if you don't want to sunbathe all day.  The hotel restaurant was very disappointing, we only ate there once and there was not much choice of places to eat within walking distance.  If I went to Madeira again I would definitely stay closer to Funchal as there is much more to do.  The room was clean but basic - fraying fabric covers over uncomfortable plastic chairs, faded synthetic blanket on the bed. There was free wifi on the beach but not in the hotel.
Yes, it is a little off from the \city center\". but in a great way. If you are comfortable at all with public transportation you are only a few stops away. Otherwise
month: it's not an expensive cab ride.  I loved that it was quiet. The rooms were lovely (the bed was super comfortable). I really enjoyed the outdoor garden to have drinks and smoke. The staff was so incredible
year: especially Angela at the front desk
extracted_date_str: who gave me great recommendations for local restaurants

text: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and had a great time. We were able to change rooms easily due to the noise from the bar across the road. We never had a problem finding sunbeds for the 3 of us by the pool. The pools and slides were great, the large pool easily catered for the large number of inflatables used. The food was great too no complaints, 8pm seemed to be a peak time where there was a short wait for being seated but other than that everything else was perfect. The rooftop bar was our favourite place to relax on an evening due to the atmosphere and view. We used the complimentary bus to the old town on numerous occasions its well worth using. All in all I would definitely recommend.

Our Lisbon trip took us to this Lisbon city hotel for 3 nights. The rooms match the description and are very tastefully decorated.Service and commitment are very important; we felt very comfortable.When we arrived there were small welcome gifts in the room (Pastels and cherry liqueur).Another positive thing to mention is the extensive breakfast buffet with great bread and some local specialties. Egg dishes were ordered a la carte and served freshly prepared.The location is also recommended; we will inquire here again first on our next trip to Lisbon.

First time staying here, though I've seen it many times.From the outside it looks like a compoundyou may find in a different country, and the entrance has a somewhat grand feel to it. However, after you pass the 5* sign outside, it stops being 5*.This isn't to say it's a bad place, it's not. But it simply isn't a 5* hotel and you will not get 5* service, rooms or stay. Mostly it's a good 3*.Location is somewhat good. It's not on the sea, but only 5 mins away, it has restaurants and bars on site and just outside, and is equidistant between the strip and the old town. It's pretty easy to drive to, or a short walk from usual drop-off points. The main road it is on, however, is irritating. Busy with cars day and night, and then the party goers at night into the wee hours. Especially bad as most rooms look onto the roads.Rooms are a good size, though balconies overlooking the roads are unattractive and virtually useless because of the roads there. Good beds, not good sofa beds. Adequate bathrooms, a kitchenette (erhem, not 5*...), the usual aparthotel stuff.Facilities - if you can avoid the gaudy 1990s trashy hotel video arcade, the bar with a pool table does a very good club sandwich, though it also does a very cringeworthy karaoke night that again reminds me of childhood holidays I'd probably rather forget. Another point to note - in a country that gets about 330 days of sun, the bar is in the basement and windowless. Probably alroght for sports, which it shows, though I wouldnt want to see the football crowd.The pool is only an ok size and in peak seasons will be crowded almost all day. There is a bar outside by the pool, but it's not cheap. The spa downstairs and gym are very good. Sadly, nobody pointed out this existed when we checked in, so I only found out about it the day I left! Therefore, I completely missed out. They're not 5* (again), but lots of equipment and spa looked very relaxing. Treatments available. Small indoor relaxing pool will be very good in winter. Though then again, it will be busier then because of it. Thinking of which, the pool outside will be unusable in winter, it's not heated. To round off the facilities, there is adequate parking and I would wager it is very safe.Service was good at reception, professional, efficient, helpful, really really good. Almost enough to make me want to go back! Sadly the rest of the hotel is not good enough to make me want to go back. Service in the bar downstairs was terrible. Housekeeping were helpful and efficient.Overall then, the hotel isn't bad if you can't get anywhere else that's reasonable. The communal areas are nice and clean, reception staff are really helpful, especially if you want to book any activities or need anything. It's good if you're driving. However, the rooms have no views, it's too busy outside, not on the beach, and you won't want to spend time on your balcony. Its location is ok but not central nor relaxing, nor on the beach. It feels like you're losing out a bit in every way, particularly given this is a pricey place to stay. My recommendation is, if you can, to stay somewhere else. I would definitely prefer the other Muthu properties in the area.

Not sure why this place is so highly rated..maybe due to the \eco friendly\" Naturally they are reluctant to turn on the air con so the hostel is very warm which isnt great after walking around outside all day you would like some cool relief.In comparison with other hostels this one lacked atmosphere
month: felt like a number & little effort made to bring the travellers together of an evening except for the standard pub crawl.  Had hoped this hostel would be a little more original in their approach to travellers but wasn't to beWasn't told about the dinners during the introduction
year: even had to locate the bathrooms myself.  Depending on which room youre in the bathrooms seem miles away.Rooms are spacious
extracted_date_str: beds comfortable with privacy curtains and fans. Breakfast is basic but satisfactory.  Great central location"

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Went for a drink in their lovely garden patio bar to while away the time before a flight home.I was charged ‚Ç¨38 for a vodka/soda. The most expensive vodka/soda I have ever bought.That alone rules out this place for a return visit. Disgraceful.

This the most fabulous little hotel. Beautifully decorated and very comfortable. It is a great location with very secure parking. The whole level of service is exemplary and the breakfast was quite outstanding and Manuela does an outstanding job to make things as comfortable as they could possibly be.

Very pleased with my stay here ‚Äì the location is perfect, and the facilities are excellent. Very clean. Every guest I met was fun, friendly, and genuine, which really added to the experience. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful throughout, including during the night shifts. Special thanks to Jo√£o, Rodrigo, and Magda ‚Äì you made the stay even better. Thank you!

We‚Äôve travel all over the world and this Hotel is among the best that we have been. Room was comfortable and clean. Location is perfect. You can walk to all central areas in Lisbon. Service is superb. Front desk go over to serve you. Breakfast is very good. We ate at the restaurant two times and it was very good. Small bar but we are not drinkers. Close to lots of shops and good restaurants. Not a single complaint from this hotel.

Stayed for one week in the ground floor apartment with pool view, it was lovely very clean and tidy. Pool once up and running was fantastic plenty of sun beds and no need to place your towels out!!! Leo's restaurant across the road ideally placed for breakfast. Hotel is in the ideal place and just a short walk from the main square and beach. If you book through Thompson they drop you at the top of the road with no explanation of where the main reception is which is directly across the road who own both buildings there is a sign on the door but didn't notice this immediately. This is an adult only hotel poolside can be a bit quiet but if that's what your after then it's fab. Would recommend this place to all.üëç

A group of us were looking for a convenient hotel on a budget to do some sightseeing and we were all very impressed. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the beds were comforatable and the bathroom was spotless. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a variety of fruit, bread, cakes, yoghourt, cheese etc. The surrounding area doesn't have a lot of bars or restuarants but it is only a couple of minutes walk to the metro or bus stops.  It was also only 15-20 mins walk to the downtown Baixia area or to Barrio Alto if you want to go out for drinks or dinner and you could window shop in Prada and Armani on the way. The only minor point is that the shower could have been a bit hotter.Overall, I would say this was excellent value and very convenient and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Superb base for a stay in Lisbon. A block from the Avenida subway station and a good walk from most \tourist\" areas if you are so inclined. Rooms are beautifully appointed and impeccably soundproofed. The staff is young
year: and very friendly. The breakfast room/restaurant/outdoor patio is truly a beautiful space and not an afterthought as in so many hotels."

text: We had a car, so were not troubled by the isolation. It¬¥s a curious place, having once been a tuna canning factory, and there is a simple museum with a bit of background history.The staff were very helpful and spoke good English, and the rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast was good and varied and one night we ate in the a la carte restaurant which has a nice setting on the first floor overlooking the river, but the food wasn't really worth the price. We didn't try the evening buffet.There's a large clean pool (only a metre deep!) with plenty of loungers in a pleasant garden setting.A separate building has a small shop on the ground floor, and a very good pool room, card room and a TV lounge. This is where the a la carte restaurant is, on the first floor. I got the impression most guests hadn't found this part of the complex, as it was always empty.The boat ride to the island is quite fun, and it's nice to ramble about on the dunes or in the woods.There's an excellent restaurant in Tavira high up near the castle, called A Ver Tavira. Bookings are advised.We got an internet rate of ‚Ç¨140 for 2 nights which was great value. I'd recommend this hotel.

Wonderful hotel, in great condition - perfect location next to the Lisbon Congress Centre and a very short walk from the river and all the lovely bars and restaurants, including the excellent SUD Lisboa

Very comfortable hotel with plenty of services, next door paid public parking and conveniently located 5min from the old town. We found the restaurant to be expensive and to have plenty of room for improvement when compared with other nearby options; good breakfast buffet though. The spa itself could maybe offer additional services but the massages were amazing - keen to repeat and try other options on the menu! Our room was somewhat particular in that its only window was on the \hall\"
month: rather than on the bedroom itself - a minor inconvenience that you may wish to check when booking."

text: Somewhat out of the way - so if looking for a convenient location - this is not it. The walk to the nearest metro station (by the Zoo on the blue line) takes about 15 minutes but once on the metro - you can be in center town at Rossio in 10 minutes - cost of return ticket about 3 Euros. There is no \supermarket' close by but there is a little market in the train station - get your water and snacks there. Standard Marriott rooms - clean and modern. But far too many as hotel can be quite busy. Breakfast is good - lots of choices including being able to have fried eggs and omelets. Big downside is lack of free wifi in rooms - absolutely ridiculous. They want 7 Euros for this privilege. Free wifi only available in the lobby. Lovely pool area and gardens. Bar staff good and attentive - all spoke good English as well as the Reception staff. Close to airport - cost of fare was 6 Euros and some change. Was not allowed to print off documents  unless I paid for it - only a boarding pass for my flight was \"free\" - found this quite irritating for a business center. Food items in the \"recharge\" shop (if you wanted a water or a chocolate bar and other snacks) were quite expensive."

My husband and me stayed here last week. For a 3 star hotel I thought the facilities were very good. It a little tired around the edges but it‚Äôs a three star so I didn‚Äôt mind. The apartment was spacious and comprised of a lounge area with a sofa, table and chairs ,tv and a wii fi hub. The quality of the WiFi was one of the things I was very impressed with. There was an adequate bath room with a shower over the bath. One bed room with ample storage and a safe. Which we paid a small amount for the week. The hotel is well situated and if you don‚Äôt mind walking within reach of the beach, the old town , restaurants and the strip. There is a train stop a short walk away that tours the area. Overall a very pleasant stay

On a recent trip to lisbon we stayed at porto bay for 4 nites. The hotel and staff were wonderful. We passed back through Lisbon when we're on our way to the airport and stayed another nite. They thanked us for returning and gave us an upgrade to a suite. Clean, new, can't say enough! And by the way, the breakfast was lovely.

Most beautiful medieval boutique hotel I had been.Only 5 rooms but all with dif theme decor.Us was like Moroccan style and we love it from the washroom the Moroccan sink bed smell of sheets and the breakfast was a plus .Sandra was a great host!!Will recommended to any one that travels to Monsaraz and walking distance to delicious restaurant with breathtaking views.The rooftop was a plus to watch sunset with a bottle of wine!!Thanks Sandra for all your help.

Indeed the hotel is new & surely that could excuse many things but then the average price of a room at 250 euros/night is outrageously expensive. Two expressos and a milk coffee for 11 Euros when about 30 meters away the same order would amount to less than four Euros. The entire staff appears to have been scouted from newly minted college graduates who weren't able to find a job in their field. It's a miracle they were able to hold open the door. When trying to book the room I had to call 7 - yes 7 - times in a row until the front desk picked up! I don't really want to waste too much of my time but for the money spent this was definitely not worth it. Next time I would opt to rather get the most expensive Air BnB apartment available before I get worked up about the unskilled staff.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Apparently this was \the\" place to be in the early 1900s. The good thing that it still is just that so many years later. The hotel is old but very
month: very well taken care of. We had a lovedly room with incredibly views. The staff was very friendly and professional. All in all we had an amazing visit and left with nothing wanting. There are many activities and the watersports are fun. Many pools and place to have private lounge chairs. In the evenings there are special treats
year: one night we had a Fado singer
extracted_date_str: the next jazz. It was hard to leave."

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: Rather than a hotel, I would say this property is a collection of small houses. Each one is huge! I felt at large on my own; great size; appreciated it a lot, and think a family of many would even more.The location is great specially to go to Ponta da Piedade (on foot). If you want to go to the city center, however, it is a little bit farther away (works better with a car).I would say also the breakfast is a plus. A lot of options (better if you go early).There are pools all over the place as well (though could not use any, the weather was still cool in May).I do have a comment regarding the cleaning. One day I got to the room at 3PM, nothing was done. I had to actually leave again, even though I wanted to rest for a little while, to see if anyone would go to do the room. Then on the following day, in which I was leaving, a cleaning lady knocked on my door AT 11 AM: didn't they know I was checking out that day? Don't know. A pity, and something that the hotel should review with their staff, as the rest was impeccable.Also take into account there are several stairs around to get to the rooms, to the pools, etc. Not suitable for someone with mobility issues.Overall, I recommend. Lagos still needs to develop their tourism (it's not Lisbon), but it's a gem.

This is the best hotel for relaxing set into the side of the mountain with a fantastic view of the ocean . The pool on the 8 floor with restaurant is amazing. The staff is the best rooms are big and very clean. This is a jewel if your looking to relax

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: What sets this hotel apart from most others is the sense of timelessness about the place, the elegant spacious interiors, and then the billiards room, card room and writing desks which are testament to the evening activities of the earlier generations, we stayed there for six nights and we were lucky that our bedroom was on the eighth floor (out of nine) positioned at the corner with a magnificent balcony view over the ocean and a side balcony overlooking the beautiful well maintained gardens. It‚Äôs restaurants deserve their accolades, our favourite was the Villa Cipriani in its location set apart from the hotel with fabulous views, food and ambience, above all else though the level of service is genuinely exceptional, so professional and friendly, the general manager made a point of personally welcoming us at our first delicious breakfast‚Ä¶we will be back!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The afternoon tea was lovely with good service. The food was plentiful and I was well catered for as a vegetarian. 5*.What let down our time was when visiting the loos and toilets there were staff shouting in the corridor to each other. It also looked very grand but on closer inspection the walls were marked and the toilets were not very clean. The service from the reception was also somewhat lacking as you expect to be greeted very quickly when reaching the desk rather than having to wait 30 seconds. Also, ‚Ç¨20 for a token amount of tea in a metal pot!??The service overall was good but it does not compare when comparing it with Quinta Jardin Do Logo.

Just returning from Forte Do Vale,  it's a lovely hotel, very clean,  maids came in every day except for Sunday.   We were all inclusive for the first time & was a bit apprehensive but the food turned out to be excellent. The room we had 224 was very spacious with washing machine & dishwasher, would be lovely for a family.  All staff were very helpful from the moment we booked in, especially Hugo in the restaurant & pool bar he was very courteous.   The hotel is ideally placed in between the Strip & the Old Town.   We used the gym which was good, there was also a Jacuzzi & indoor pool as well as the outside pool.  Entertainment at night could be improved on, although Elvis was very good!  The view from our room could have been better, there is a disused tennis court on top of the unused shops & if this area was made into a relaxing sun bed area perhaps it would be better.  All in all a great holiday,  lovely hotel & would definitely come back again.

One of the best hostels I have stayed so far. Great vibes, perfect for socializing, huge outside area, a bar, good breakfast and everything was clean. The volunteers are very fun and they organize some events everyday. I can highly recommend the pub crawls and the sunset walk :)

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
text: Employees at the reception super friendly and attentive, clarify any doubts. Large pool with jacuzzi. The breakfast is delicious. There is parking outside and still in the garage. The only drawback is the sauna and the Turkish bath stay away from the pool.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Afternoon tea was served in the elegant lounge of this old colonial hotel.  A selection of sandwiches, scones and cakes can be taken with the tea blend of your choice. Views out to sea and the mellow sounds of the pianist leave you feeling relaxed and as if you've sampled a little bit of the genteel life of times gone by.

Wonderful hotel with amazing people and service on a perfect location in Porto! The palace building is a sight to see and our room 1 was exquisite both in style and comfort! Will definitely return here when in Porto again!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We first visited for cocktails on the terrace which was wonderful. The lights of Madeira make the view spectacular, Cocktails were expensive; twice that of our 5star hotel but worth it for the experience. The hotel is beautiful and the bar and waiting staff great.We visited again to attend a classical concert in the wonderfully decorated dining room. This again was fantastic and was reasonably priced including a class of wine.A huge disappointment was afternoon tea which we booked as part of our tour. We were seated well away from the other guests in a side room and thoroughfare to the toilets. The food was distinctly average although the scones were good, Champagne was 25‚Ç¨ ahead - we didn't try it. The staff were not unpleasant but they weren't attentive and we felt as if we were second class citizens. We absolutely didn't get the experience expected and given to our fellow travellers who booked separately.

This is a really amazing hotel with all the facilities you could want.  The staff are really friendly and eager to help.  The room was airy with amazing views of the sea and sunset.  There was nothing missing at breakfast and the food at the restaurant was really good.

Stayed here for a few days, it was a reasonable price. We needed to put a hundred euros deposit down which I thought was quite steep. Couldnt check in until 3pm, but could store luggage in room outside not the reception in a locked door. It was around 30 mins away from the airport. There was somewhere to get changed but was the showers and toilet to the pool. The room was very spacious large kitchen, with all facilitates, bathroom, bedroom with two beds and a lounge with beds and a balcony which was outside to the pool however although on ground level they did have shutters. Towels are provided, wifi is too but connection is poor. Only available in the lobby. The pool was clean but went mercy towards the end of the stay. There is a bar/food area. Food is reasonable price and tastes good. The bar had a good selection of drinks but service was very slow. There is plenty to eat around the area and a shop within a five minute walk. The hotel was clean but it defiantly dated. On first impression I wasn't impressed but for how much you use the room its okay. And the space was nice. The strip is a 10-15 minute walk away. There was aircon in the room too. I wouldn't call this luxury, it was cheep and cheerful and serves a purpose.

(1) room was different to the photos online (the room was not nice like on the photos)(2) there were sick guests/ guest being housed on my floor, I heard coughing and being sick from the bathroom continuously(3) drugs offered at the doorway, rough Barrio(4) it‚Äôs a party hostel and there was a loud party with music etc until 03.00 am I could not sleep and I checked out(5) I booked 12 nights and after a nightmare first night I checked out. They billed me for the full 12 nights and refused a refund(6) located in a rough area with many ethnic dealers operating in the close proximity(7) very bad service from a Brazilian girl who works at reception. Focused on taking your money and no solutions

Despite breaking my ankle and having surgery on day 3, we loved it there. So gracious and helpful with my injury, they went out of their way to make me comfortable.Great breakfast, loved the room and patio, walking paths along the sea and an excellent restaurant for dinner. The lasagne was amazing!We purchased our own wine at the market as their house wine started at $17/bottle. Excellent for a hotel, but $5.oo in the market.Try to avoid vacation weeks if you don‚Äôt like a lot of children.

Great location and very friendly staff. Accommodation was perfect for us and so close to everything. Apartment was clean and bad comfortable. I would buy a towel from a vendor down the strip as it cheaper than the rental option here. Very centrally located for uber and taxis as well.

A rural hotel out of the ordinary, an old convent adapted, with history and places for great walks and good photos, well framed in the landscapes of the mountains of Ossa.The interior is rich in details from other times.The rooms aren't all the same. Some are located in the main building, some larger and others smaller, which were the old cells. Others are located in a building 200 metres away, a little uncomfortable for cold or rainy days.We stayed two nights in room 122 2 years ago and now four nights in 126, both big, very comfortable bed, four pillows, good air conditioning and good size TV. Negative, to be corrected: morning noise in the hallways of the rooms caused by the loud conversations of the ladies of cleaning, which should be contained.Good breakfast buffet with reasonable variety of products. Two years ago there was true orange juice, now there were those juices made with water.Much sympathy in the service.Good parking.

Stayed here for four nights only, we had the last room available, room 1.when the owner Eunice said it was the last room , and also the smallest room, and  faced the street, I expected  to be dissapointed, but it was quite the opposite, it was a lovely room, very clean , comfy bed, and we had the use of the balcony , overlooking the sea, with fantastic views , really laid back atmosphere , great for couples, beautiful guest house.

The Crown Plaza was one of the first hotels to be built in the area and although there is a lot of upgrading underway and the rooms , pool area and gardens are all tip top it does feel a little dated in places.The location is good - a few minutes from the beach , ten minutes to the Marina and a fifteen minute walk along the boardwalk to Quarteria , with its fishmarket and old town vibe.Our room was on Floor 9 with views to the west and Vilamoura - the balcony catches the sun in the afternoon - this was a great place enjoy the sunset. The room was comfortable although the greenhouse like shower room and loo will not be to everyones taste. The pool area is well planned - there were enough sunbeds during our stay - in season there are beds and brollies around the garden - there is a childrens pool and playpark. The pool bar was good.Staff were professional and breakfast was varied and good quality - the pastries being my favourite.I would return for another stay.

We visited the Natural Algarve Club in Feb/Mar and were delighted when we arrived. The Natura was only partially open as it was early in the season but we still had fabulous service. The young lady who booked us in and was extremely helpful, we arrived mid morning so were expecting to  have to wait hours. As it was we only had to wait a couple of hours, just long enough to wander a few hundred yards f to enjoy a drink and some early lunch. The Natura is situated in a quiet area but still just minutes away from numerous bars, cafes and restaurants catering for every taste and budget. The pool area was clean and tidy with some comfy sunbeds. The apartment was larger than many, with a separate kitchen containing a full cooker, fridge,and a washing machine. We had e mailed the Natura to ask for a.ground floor apartment due to health problems and they went out of their way to ensure we had one. It was unfortunate that the snack bar and bar were due to open a few days after we left. We will definitely return, hopefully next year. Well done the Natura Algarve Club, keep up the good work.

We stayed here for 4nights, and due to it not being in season we found the hotel mainly for older people. The single beds are on tiled floor and have no material under the legs to stop the noise when you roll over as the beds are very flimsy. The sofa bed however was a better option. We had a pool view apartment to which we opened the doors on the Sunday afternoon and found dog poo outside the doors, this was still there the Thursday we left. The receptionist who checked us in and out was lovely. Although the rest were unpleasant and lacked in customer service.

Canto de Luz not only lived up to our expectations it surpassed them. The hotel is exactly what we were looking for, a small boutique hotel with exceptional people who really go out of their way to make your stay the best. Highly recommend it. Our suite was perfect and made a great home base for exploring Porto.

Firstly we were absolutely anxious to come here having read all the awful reviews but initial impressions were good. We arrived quite late at night, no porter to help us with bags or find our room which was a nightmare. We ended up going back to reception and a much more helpful young man told us he will find a porter and to put our luggage away til he is free, we were shown to our room which although was basic (what we paid for) was adequate. It even had a bath which is a huge bonus for me.The resort itself is really nice beautiful tropical gardens fountains and two beautiful swimming pools to cool off. The beach is a short walk away too. The food is very basic for all inclusive and limited to one place in the hotel and also the drinks are only in one bar. We ended up eating out for dinner most nights but breakfast and lunch was good. The restaurant manager Aman was really friendly and recommended places for us to go out in the old town.Just as the other reviews had mentioned it can get rowdy here although the first two nights were quiet our last two evenings were spoilt by a loud group of young men who came and went at all hours shouting and swearing. They broke the patio door glass everywhere dumped litter on the gardens and broke the security gate to the complex. We have reported this to the duty manager but we were too intimidated to do so at the time.As the title says mixed reviews as we√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve enjoyed a short break and found the quieter pool nice to relax, the staff couldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have been more friendly and helpful yet the type of clients let the place down. They say they don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t allow stags and hens but if they book separately they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re powerless to stop them.Would we stay here again.. in a nutshell no.

The hotel is very good for people who enjoy swimming pools. There is one for children and two for adults.The outside pool is on a great spot with views of the ocean and palmtrees. The inside pool and jacuzy smell of desinfectants which make the place a bit intoxicating.The beaches are a short walking distance ( 5/10 minutes). You should be in good shape to go down and up for a while. The Senhora da Rocha beach has a very good restaurant. From there you get to a very beautiful beach, Praia Nova,through a small clean tunnel cut on the rocks.

We spent a week at Canto de Luz, enjoying the house, our room, the garden, without forgetting the breakfast ! Brigitte and Andr√É¬© made us felt comfortable there, giving us also very good ideas to explore the smart city of Porto. Definitely, the good spot.

Very nice small family hotel35 rooms in the center of FunchalBreakfast and small lunch/snack facilityHelpfull and friendly personelNice small garden and swimmingpoolBy leaving the back-door of the hotel you are  directtly in the old center of Funchalclose to several good restaurantsMenu's for 10- 15 euro are very good

Be very careful about the room you book in this hotel. The front rooms have a fantastic view onto the river. However the hotel is basically in a carved-out area of cliff, and the rear rooms look directly onto the rear rock at a distance of about 2 meters. I paid Euro 180 per night and was unpleasantly surprised to get a rear-facing room with little natural daylight - I would say it was worth about Euro 100 per night. I complained and got a room change the next day.If my whole stay had been in a rear room, I would have given this hotel one star in terms of quality-to-price. Given that I was moved to a river-facing room on my second day, and given that it is a clean modern hotel with excellent staff (actually the Portuenses as a whole are very nice people, it's definitely a great city to visit), and given that breakfast was reasonably good, it deserves a high rating. So I will split the difference with three stars, and this review is a warning to be careful about room choice when booking.

We had to cancel because our two dogs were very sick and we could not leave them. They refused to refund our money, stating that I had agreed to the no refund policy, even though the situation was bad. No compassion. They were too rigid with their  cancelatuon policy.

The rooms are beautifully designed and furnished, the breakfast was fantastic (homemade bread, great cheeses), the bikes were great fun to use at dusk, the pool area was quiet and relaxing, and the staff were very friendly and kind. Highly recommend visiting the nearby Monsaraz castle during your stay.

stayed a week here with my son and cousin rooms are very clean get maid service every day and clean towels. no over in room but dish washer which is strange would off been better with oven but over all great. staff very friendly. very close to supermarket and strip is 10 min walk old town 25 min walk but can get train or taxi. pool opens at 8.30 beds went quick but all get sun till late evening. would stay here again.

Starting with the reception team, who made our arrival/check-in simple and pleasant, the facilities very comfortable, the room super pleasant and clean, the bathroom impeccable and the view of the Elvas aqueduct TOP.The buffet breakfast, very diverse and with great products, the room team that does everything to make us feel at home and is always available to meet our requests, is 5 stars.The best swimming pool...TOP location, 3 min. walk from the center of Elvas, 10 minutes from Badajoz and very close to other must-see spots.It has charging for electric vehicles.

I travel oftenly to Lisbon, either for business or pleasure since 20 years, and for this short trip (only one day) I decided to try the Altis Belem; and I really enjoyed it. The rooms are big, with a lot of natural sun light, overlooking the river and with a wonderfull barthroom and a heavenly bed. The reception crew is great and always helpful. Breackfast also very good. Really a 5 stars.I didn't try their restaurant but it has a Michelin star, so it should be good. I didn't try the spa either. You have great caf√É¬©s and restaurants at the river paseo and amazing sunset views over the marina nearby. All was really a pleasure and just 5 minutes away by taxy from the busy centre. I will definetely come back.

We have been here only for one night. The location is great. it is a big hotel and rooms could be better. When you book you don¬¥t get necessary the room you booked. Breakfast  was ok but the reception department should be more efficient and helpful. It was ok for one night.

Great location right on the Tejo river in a very nice and tranquil suburb of Lisbon.You can walk all the way to Lisbon city if you like or take a taxi for under 10 √¢‚Äö¬¨The suite we stayed in was very well designed and maintained and had a fantastic river view from its terrace.Breakfast was ample by South European standards.We should also mention the friendly staff and the good restaurant -  an option well worth considering, especially if you arrive late at in the evening and cannot be bothered to go to the city for dinner.

i stayed here 14th june to 17th june with my husband and and my 21yr old son and 14yr old daughter we got a taxi from airport which was only ‚Ç¨17 great value when we checked in at 10.30 we were told they were going to upgrade us to a 2 bed apartment because they weren't overly busy the 2 girls on reception were v friendly the 2 bed apartment was perfect we had 2 bathrooms a sitting room little kitchen with toaster cooker  fridge and microwave apartment was v clean with air conditioning i would highly reccomend this hotel staff are lovely and it is on 10mins walk to the metro where for ‚Ç¨6.80 you can go on any metro or bus for 24hrs we didn't have breakfast at the hotel we cooked in the kitchen 2 mornings and ate out on the 3rd and 4th mornings there is a mc donalds across the road also this hotel is in the business district so not many shops but with the metro so close you don't need them there is a chemist and small supermarket close by i would def stay here again the pool was lovely just v cold one thing I would say is we were on the 7th floor and the windows opened right in i wouldn't like to have small children up that high it is not safe they should have safety catches on the windows

This hotel is the best I've stayed at. The rooms are decorated in a modern style with great gadgets, blue tooth for phones, glass walled showers and a fantastic view of the river - whichever side of the hotel you stay on. The spa facilities on the top floor are excellent, very chilled out atmosphere and an amazing floor to ceiling glass wall overlooking the river in the sauna! The restaurant food was very good, recommend the pork and the 3 taster pudding. The breakfast had a very large choice and the staff on both meal occasions were very attentive and polite. Cannot fault the service on the front desk, restaurant, spa or the young lad who parked our car and took our bags to the room. Nothing we asked for was any trouble and we felt very welcome. Will definitely be coming again!

This is a very modern and beautiful hotel.  The pros would be:  Great views from the rooms.  Rooms are very comfortable and sound proofed.  The gym and spa are well-equipped.  Staff is very friendly and attentive.  Cons:  This is not located in what I would call the best area of town.  Unless you want cod for every meal, the restaurants are not that great.  They also do not match the quality of what  you would expect around a hotel of this type.  You may take a cab or metro to the part of the city where the sightseeing and shopping is located.  That will run you about 10 euros each way.  The restaurant in the hotel leaves a lot to be desired.  Since you are basically captive unless you want to take a cab, they make sure to take full advantage on their prices.  1 bottle of sparkling water was 6 euros.  A latte was 6.5 euros.  Squash soup was 12 euros.  The quality did not match the prices.  I would definitely recommend that you take the  \breakfast included\" option or you will find yourself having to take a cab to eat breakfast unless you would like to pay 35 euros.  If you have to get to the airport which is only 4 km away
month: make sure to ask for a regular cab which should be no more than 5 euros
year: because the hotel will call for their driver who will charge you 15 euros.  I fully understand that prices are higher at hotels
extracted_date_str: but this was over the top and offensive.  I would not stay here again for that reason.  You might as well stay at the Four Seasons which is better situated and a wash on price."

text: This was our second stay at the wonderful Cliff Bay. We just love it here and we were looked after so well! Everything is perfect and we can‚Äôt wait to return! I had tears in my eyes when I left.

My wife and I went with our 2 small children and found the apartments extremely comfortable with big comfy beds and huge living spaces. The apartments themselves had a definite wow! factor as well - they look great. Built in plasma screens, electronic safes in each bedroom. The bathrooms were spacious and well presented. We were all very happy there and I would recomend it. It has quite a business feel to it though so may not be suitable for those more interested in the rustic. Its location is fine as it is in the CBD of Lisbon which is quite quiet and a bit away from the \downtown\" bustle - but its not in the heart of everything. Only critisism would be that the staff were not too friendly."

Only spent one night in this charming hotel. A comfortable room with a serene view of the river and a picturesque park from our small balcony.  Large bath.  Good location in this quaint town. Overall, a very nice stay.

Stayed here while on tour of Northern Portugal.  Hotel is modern, but decor is sparse and inexpensive.  Hallways are really dark, with low ceilings.  Junior suit is good option with kids, with semi separate bedroom and two twin cots in living room.  Pool only allows kids before 5:30, which was disappointing at end long day on the road.  Didn't use spa because of timing, so can't comment on the facilities.  Food is ok, but nothing special.  recommend going for more traditional hotel.

A romantic weekend away started badly with a bus load of Brazilians overwhelming the solitary man on reception... Having been checked in we made our way to out suite on the 5th floor. What greeted us was essentially a larger version of a shabby Ibis...The Suite is best summed up by the presence of a plastic sofa... The minibar was practically empty and they were not able to stock it with anything other than two beers....The bed was uncomfortable & the TV so small & so far away that watching anything was a waste of time.In summary, this is the last time I will EVER visit a Villa Gale hotel as this experience was so bad I would not even wish to die here....I admit this was intended to be a romantic weekend away but seriously, a PLASTIC sofa ???? This is a 4 star hotel not a low budget porn video !!

Visiting Tomar was an incredible experience.  The history and the structures are amazing.  There are not many choices of hotels right in town and the Hotel dos Templarios is a reasonable choice.  The hotel is clean and in a convenient location. I didn‚Äôt find anything special about the hotel and there were some minor quirks, but overall It was fine.

Very well received when making chekin.The room was wonderful. üòäVery friendly collaborators. All spectacular.I loved visiting this guest house because it is beautiful and has everything very close which facilitates the walk to know the city. Thank you hostel of Viseu.

Although the hotel photos looked promising, you can never be sure with some of the Pousadas in Portugal. However the Pousada Viseu was very good. Staff were helpful and the hotel which is in a converted derelict hospital is massive but has only 84 rooms.Our superior room (not much more expensive than a standard when we booked) was huge with a massive bed, lots of storage space, a big bathroom with a bath and a separate walk in shower, plus a terrace overlooking the town and the outdoor pool.There is a spa with small indoor pool and gym and the restaurant serves above standard food at reasonable prices. Viseu is a nice city of about 100,000 people but the old town which is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel has plenty of bars, restaurants, shops and historic sights.Well worth a couple of days stay or overnight on the way to Porto and the north of the country if travelling from Lisbon.
